org.apache.flink.api.common

Class PlanExecutor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flink.api.common.PlanExecutor
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    LocalExecutor, RemoteExecutor

    public abstract class PlanExecutor
extends Object
    A PlanExecutor runs a plan. The specific implementation (such as the org.apache.flink.client.LocalExecutor and org.apache.flink.client.RemoteExecutor) determines where and how to run the plan.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PlanExecutor() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlanExecutor

        public PlanExecutor()

    • Method Detail

      • executePlan

        public abstract JobExecutionResult executePlan(Plan plan)
                                        throws Exception
        Execute the given plan and return the runtime in milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        plan - The plan of the program to execute.
        Returns:
        The execution result, containing for example the net runtime of the program, and the accumulators.
        Throws:
        Exception - Thrown, if job submission caused an exception.

      • getOptimizerPlanAsJSON

        public abstract String getOptimizerPlanAsJSON(Plan plan)
                                       throws Exception
        Gets the programs execution plan in a JSON format.
        Parameters:
        plan - The program to get the execution plan for.
        Returns:
        The execution plan, as a JSON string.
        Throws:
        Exception - Thrown, if the executor could not connect to the compiler.

      • createLocalExecutor

        public static PlanExecutor createLocalExecutor()
        Creates an executor that runs the plan locally in a multi-threaded environment.
        Returns:
        A local executor.

      • createRemoteExecutor

        public static PlanExecutor createRemoteExecutor(String hostname,
                                                int port,
                                                String... jarFiles)
        Creates an executor that runs the plan on a remote environment. The remote executor is typically used to send the program to a cluster for execution.
        Parameters:
        hostname - The address of the JobManager to send the program to.
        port - The port of the JobManager to send the program to.
        jarFiles - A list of jar files that contain the user-defined function (UDF) classes and all classes used from within the UDFs.
        Returns:
        A remote executor.
